section.title: Overall goals
section.para: The overall goals of our test environment is to execute tests that ensures that we have full coverage of the code in Fungal.

A single test case can be executed using

You can also execute all test cases of a single module using
where -Dmodule specifies which module to execute the test cases in. This parameter defaults to core.
The build script does not fail in case of test errors or failure.
You can control the behavior by using the junit.haltonerror and junit.haltonfailure properties in the main build.xml file. Default value for both is no.

You can of course change them statically in the build.xml file or temporary using -Djunit.haltonerror=yes. There are other jnuit.* properties defined in the main build.xml that can be controlled in the same way.

section.title: Quality Assurance
section.para: In addition to the test suite the Fungal project deploys various tools to increase the stability of the project.
The following sections will describe each of these tools.

section.title: Checkstyle
section.para: Checkstyle is a tool that verifies that the formatting of the source code in the project is consistent.
This allows for easier readability and a consistent feel of the project.

section.title: Findbugs
section.para: Findbugs is a tool that scans your project for bugs and provides reports based on its findings.
This tool helps lower of the number of bugs found in the Fungal project.
The goal is to have zero errors in the report and as few exclusions in the filter as possible. The findbugs report is generated using

section.title: Cobertura
section.para: Cobertura generates a test suite matrix for your project which helps you identify where you need additional test coverage.
The reports that the tool provides makes sure that the Fungal project has the correct test coverage.
The goal is to have as high code coverage as possible in all areas. The Cobertura report is generated using

section.title: Tattletale
section.para: Tattletale generates reports about different quality matrix of the dependencies within the project.
The reports that the tool provides makes sure that the Fungal project doesn't for example have cyclic dependencies within the project.
